2022-12-01.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2022-12-01.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-12-01.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-12-01.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-12-01.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-12-01.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-12-01.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-12-01.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2022-12-01.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2022-12-01.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2022-12-01.name: Rotary Lights
2022-12-01.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There are also carriage and helicopter rides, an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2022-12-01.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-12-01.summary: This Christmas market in Principal Park, on the river confluence downtown, features vendors and food plus many performances by bands, choirs, carolers, fiddlers and dance troupes.

2022-12-01.name: Kerstmarkt and Christmas Tour of Homes
2022-12-01.summary: In this Dutch town, there's an Old World open-air market and a tour of homes decorated for the holidays. On Saturday, Sinterklaas arrives in a wooden ship, wears a bishop's miter and has a Moorish servant as helper. He leads a parade from Scholte Church at 10 a.m.Â

2022-12-02.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2022-12-02.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-12-02.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-12-02.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-12-02.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-12-02.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-12-02.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-12-02.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2022-12-02.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2022-12-02.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2022-12-02.name: ZooLights
2022-12-02.summary: Admission to the annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays. Reserve time slots in advance.

2022-12-02.name: Festive Friday Eves
2022-12-02.summary: Christmas celebrations, each with a different theme, are held at Cedar Creek Settlement,  a restored 1864 woolen mill in this historic village just north of Milwaukee. Each features live holiday music, crafts, luminaries, wine-tasting and cookies and cider.

2022-12-02.name: Holiday Kerstmarkt
2022-12-02.summary: This open-air European Christmas Market at the Eighth Street Market  Place includes 18 timber booths offering Dutch imports, folk art,  hand-knit apparel and other gifts.

2022-12-02.name: Rotary Lights
2022-12-02.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There are also carriage and helicopter rides, an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2022-12-02.name: European Christmas Market
2022-12-02.summary: This Christkindlmarkt in Union Depot features choirs, dancers, hot mulled wine, holiday beers,  European-inspired food and artisan goods.

2022-12-02.name: Chris Kringle Market
2022-12-02.summary: This town on the Illinois River kicks off its downtown festival with a parade, followed by fireworks.

2022-12-02.name: Door County Christkindlmarkt
2022-12-02.summary: This market on the grounds of the Corner of the Past Museum, a recreated pioneer homestead south of town, features local vendors and artisans, live music, and German dishes served inside a large barn.

2022-12-02.name: Christmas Walk and House Tour
2022-12-02.summary: In this northwest Illinois town, Santa Lucia arrives in a horse-drawn carriage on Friday and hands out Swedish cookies, then Santa lights the Great Tree and opens his Gingerbread House. There's shopping amid strolling carolers. A tour of five houses is Friday and Saturday.

2022-12-02.name: Christkindli Market
2022-12-02.summary: In this Swiss town, the outdoor Christmas market downtown features decorated mini-chalets, food and music.Â

2022-12-02.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-12-02.summary: This Christmas market in Principal Park, on the river confluence downtown, features vendors and food plus many performances by bands, choirs, carolers, fiddlers and dance troupes.

2022-12-02.name: Christmas in the Ward
2022-12-02.summary: Festivities in the rejuvenated Third Ward near downtown start the Milwaukee Police Band, followed by tree lighting, a Bach choir, gospel singers, carriage rides, carolers, and a cookie sale.

2022-12-02.name: Prelude to Christmas
2022-12-02.summary: In this formerly communal village in eastern Iowa, visit the decorated Tannenbaum Forest, buy at the craft bazaar, go on a pickle hunt and listen to Santa stories.

2022-12-02.name: Dickens of a Christmas
2022-12-02.summary: This Victorian-themed festival kicks off with a parade and includes a Tour of Homes , wagon rides, an Enchanted Forest of decorated trees and a gingerbread-house contest. The Living Windows end the festival on Saturday night.

2022-12-02.name: Sinterklaas Eve
2022-12-02.summary: In this Dutch town, St. Nicholas, or Sinterklaas, arrives on his white horse, surrounded by his Zwarte Piet  helpers. At 7 p.m., Sinterklaas leads a lantern procession to the Kerstmarkt holiday market.

2022-12-02.name: Fire & Ice Festival
2022-12-02.summary: This town between Monroe and Beloit celebrates with horse-drawn carriage rides, fire rings, ice sculptures, an arts-and-crafts show, luminaries, a lighted parade Friday and frozen T-shirt, gingerbread, decorated-pet and Cindy Lou Who contests.Â

2022-12-02.name: Holiday Light Parade
2022-12-02.summary: This arty town on the Wisconsin River, home to Frank Lloyd Wright's Taliesen as well as House on the Rock, offers a lighted parade at 6 p.m. on Jefferson Street, followed by a concert.

2022-12-02.name: Christkindl Festival
2022-12-02.summary: A candlelight procession and tree lighting start this traditional German market fair. There's also Friday fireworks, live reindeer, horse-drawn trolley rides, music and a Christkindl Night of Lights Parade.

2022-12-02.name: Kerstmarkt and Christmas Tour of Homes
2022-12-02.summary: In this Dutch town, there's an Old World open-air market and a tour of homes decorated for the holidays. On Saturday, Sinterklaas arrives in a wooden ship, wears a bishop's miter and has a Moorish servant as helper. He leads a parade from Scholte Church at 10 a.m.Â

2022-12-02.name: Holidazzle
2022-12-02.summary: This free holiday market in Loring Park, on the edge of downtown, features an artisan market, appearances by Santa and the illuminated Holidazzle Yeti, outdoor yoga, choirs, a beer garden and fireworks.

2022-12-03.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2022-12-03.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-12-03.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2022-12-03.summary: This Christkindlmarkt in Union Depot features choirs, dancers, hot mulled wine, holiday beers,  European-inspired food and artisan goods.

2022-12-03.summary: This town on the Illinois River kicks off its downtown festival with a parade, followed by fireworks.

2022-12-03.name: Norwegian Christmas Weekend
2022-12-03.summary: In the northeast Iowa bluffs, Vesterheim Norwegian-American Museum will have Scandinavian food, theater, music, folk-art demonstrations, singing around the Jule tree and appearances by Julenisse and Julebukker.

2022-12-03.name: Christkindl Festival
2022-12-03.summary: A candlelight procession and tree lighting start this traditional German market fair. There's also Friday fireworks, live reindeer, horse-drawn trolley rides, music and a Christkindl Night of Lights Parade.

2022-12-03.name: Kerstmarkt and Christmas Tour of Homes
2022-12-03.summary: In this Dutch town, there's an Old World open-air market and a tour of homes decorated for the holidays. On Saturday, Sinterklaas arrives in a wooden ship, wears a bishop's miter and has a Moorish servant as helper. He leads a parade from Scholte Church at 10 a.m.Â

2022-12-03.name: Twinkle Party
2022-12-03.summary: Get a free twinkle light in Lowell Park, listen to music and watch the tree-lighting and fireworks. It's from 4 to 5:30 p.m.

2022-12-03.name: Electric Christmas Parade
2022-12-03.summary: This lighted parade down Broad and Main streets starts at 5 p.m.

2022-12-03.name: Holidazzle
2022-12-03.summary: This free holiday market in Loring Park, on the edge of downtown, features an artisan market, appearances by Santa and the illuminated Holidazzle Yeti, outdoor yoga, choirs, a beer garden and fireworks.

2022-12-03.name: Frothbite Beer & Bites Festival
2022-12-03.summary: This festival inside the La Crosse Center features cheese, sausage and craft beer from more than 40 breweries.

2022-12-10.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There are also carriage and helicopter rides, an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2022-12-10.name: European Christmas Market
2022-12-10.summary: This Christkindlmarkt in Union Depot features choirs, dancers, hot mulled wine, holiday beers,  European-inspired food and artisan goods.

2022-12-10.name: Chris Kringle Market
2022-12-10.summary: This town on the Illinois River kicks off its downtown festival with a parade, followed by fireworks.

2022-12-10.name: Door County Christkindlmarkt
2022-12-10.summary: This market on the grounds of the Corner of the Past Museum, a recreated pioneer homestead south of town, features local vendors and artisans, live music, and German dishes served inside a large barn.

2022-12-10.name: Holidazzle
2022-12-10.summary: This free holiday market in Loring Park, on the edge of downtown, features an artisan market, appearances by Santa and the illuminated Holidazzle Yeti, outdoor yoga, choirs, a beer garden and fireworks.

2022-12-10.name: Night of the Luminaria
2022-12-10.summary: More than 5,000 candle-lit luminaria line the streets of this historic town and 30 windows become animated.

2022-12-11.name: Bentleyville Tour of Lights
2022-12-11.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-12-11.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-12-11.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-12-11.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-12-11.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-12-11.name: Christkindlmarket
2022-12-11.summary: This is the most authentic Old World Christmas market, with many German vendors who bring over toys, ornaments and sweets. There's a Children's Lantern Parade, appearances by the Christkind and entertainment most days. In Daley Plaza in the Loop.

2022-12-11.name: Christkindlmarket Wrigleyville
2022-12-11.summary: This North Side satellite of the Daley Plaza Christkindlmarket features ice-skating, wreath-making, music and Santa's Workshop as well as holiday vendors.

2022-12-11.name: ZooLights
2022-12-11.summary: Admission to the annual display of 2.5 million lights at the Lincoln Park Zoo is $5 per person. Tickets are free on Mondays. Reserve time slots in advance.

2022-12-25.summary:
Tour the retro-cool lighted decorations in Bayfront Festival Park, including a tree that dances to music, Dinosaurland and Penguin Park, and visit with Santa and Mrs. Claus.
There's free hot chocolate, cookies, popcorn and marshmallows to roast over fire pits. Bring cash or food to donate to food shelves.

2022-12-25.name: Holiday Fantasy in Lights
2022-12-25.summary: The free display in Olin Park is open from dusk to dawn.

2022-12-25.name: Holiday Lights Festival
2022-12-25.summary: The season-long lights festival includes more than 500,000 lights throughout downtown's parks and streets.

2022-12-25.name: Rotary Lights
2022-12-25.summary: In Riverside Park, see a holiday display of 3 million lights with music. It opens with a parade, and Santa and reindeer are there every night through Dec. 23, with a live Nativity some nights. There are also carriage and helicopter rides, an ice rink with free use of skates, and free s'mores at fire pits.

2022-12-31.name: Cherry Ball Drop
2022-12-31.summary: In this town on Grand Traverse Bay, there's music from 10:30 p.m., and a large illuminated cherry drops 115 feet at midnight.

2022-12-31.name: New Year's Eve Ball Drop
2022-12-31.summary: The party in this Lake Michigan beach town includes music, dancing, a beer tent, a lighted ball drop and fireworks.

2022-12-31.name: Pierogi Drop
2022-12-31.summary: This suburb of Chicago with Polish roots celebrates the new year by dropping a 10-foot illuminated pierogi, or filled dumpling, into a boiling cauldron at midnight. There will also be music and fireworks.

2022-12-31.name: Cheese Drop
2022-12-31.summary: At this family-friendly event at the Plymouth Arts Center, there will be live music, cheese-tasting, hot cocoa and a bonfire beforeÂ an 80-pound lighted wedge of cheese is dropped 100 feet at 10 p.m. It's followed by more music and a champagne toast at midnight.
